description:
With FlatManager/FlatDHCP Manager, use_ipv6=true cause instance boot error.
Because nova-network doesn't set up IPv6 feature properly.

We are fixing this problem.

Workaround: please set use_ipv6 flag to false. (default is false after revision 579)
title: Cannot boot instances under use_ipv6=true and with FlatManager/FlatDHCPManager

comments.content:
With FlatManager/FlatDHCP Manager, use_ipv6=true cause instance boot error.
Because nova-network doesn't set up IPv6 feature properly.

We are fixing this problem.

Workaround: please set use_ipv6 flag to false. (default is false after revision 579)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~iida-koji

comments.content:
We fixed boot the problem of FlatDHCPManager.
However, we would like to postpone to support ipv6 in FlatManager until Cactus release.
Because our current ipv6 implementation is based on the RA Server, however  FlatManager don't use the RA Server.
So, the fixation needs many changes in current code.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nati-ueno

comments.content: That sounds like a good idea. Could you explain here (and/or document in the wiki) which network modes are supported in Bexar with ipv6 ? All but FlatManager ? Also could you file a blueprint for Cactus about supporting IPv6 in those missing network modes ? Thanks !
